Introduction Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) technologies have been hailed as the future of security. ZTNA creates a perimeter around an application and blocks all unauthorised traffic. This guide will show you how to implement a clientless VPN for your web apps.
Prerequisites Cloudflared running in Debian. IIS Webserver Cloudflare access account Zero Trust Architecture How to Implement Zero Trust using Cloudflare 1. Navigate to Cloudflare. 2. Enter you Email and Password. 3. Type "your@email.com" 4. Click "Zero Trust" 5. Click "Access" 6. Click "Create a tunnel" 7. Click the "Tunnel name(Required)" field. Type "CF-Tunnel" as Tunnel name Click "Save tunnel" 8. Click Debian as the operating system. 9. Click Copy icon to install in Cloudflare connector. 10. Click "Next" 11. Click domain. Click "zerotrustmodel.org" Click the "Subdomain" field. In subdomain type iis and domain. Click "Select..." Select "HTTP" Click the "Public hostname(Required)" field. Type "192.168.133.11" for Web Apps server Click "Save CF-Tunnel tunnel" 12. Navigate back to access then tunnel. 13. Click "Configure" 14. Click "Private Network" 15. Click "Add a private network" 16. Click the "CIDR(Required)" field. Type IIS server IP and Click "Save private network" 17. Click "Add a private network" again. 18. Type cloudflared server IP and Click "Save private network" 19. Click "Overview" 19. Try access https://iis.zerotrustmodel.org/ will redirect to zero trust.
title: How to Implement Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) using Cloudflare

1. How to install Acme using Git Please provide a valid email address.
1git clone https://github.com/acmesh-official/acme.sh.git 2cd acme.sh 3./acme.sh --install --accountemail "security@example.com" 4source ~/.bashrc 5cd 2. Issue SAN Certs using Standalone validation with acme.sh 1acme.sh --issue --standalone -d example.com -d www.example.com --ocsp-must-staple --keylength 2048 3. Issue SAN Certs using Webroot validation with acme.sh 1acme.sh --issue -d example.com -d www.example.com --webroot /var/www/_letsencrypt --reloadcmd "sudo systemctl reload nginx.service" --ocsp-must-staple --keylength 2048 4. Issue Wildcard Certs using DNS API validation with acme.sh 1acme.sh --issue --dns dns_cf -d example.com -d '*.example.com' --ocsp-must-staple --keylength 2048 5. Display all the certs. 1acme.sh --list 5. Create folder for the certs. 1mkdir -p /etc/acmeprovider/example.com 6. Copy the certificates to the proper location Make sure to change out example.com for your domain
1acme.sh --install-cert 2 --domain example.com 3 --cert-file /etc/acmeprovider/example.com/cert.pem 4 --key-file /etc/acmeprovider/example.com/key.pem 5 --fullchain-file /etc/acmeprovider/example.com/fullchain.pem Youâ€™ll then need to install them in the proper location for your web server
title: How to install ACME client protocol
